info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 6:05PM PDT until September 01 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN NYE AND WEST CENTRAL CLARK COUNTIES... At 605 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Upwards of two inches of rain have fallen over the Spring Mountains with another round of heavy rain on the way. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump, Rainbow Canyon, Mt. Charleston, Spring Mountains, Red Rock Canyon, Summerlin, Mcwilliams Campground, Dolomite Campground, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Kyle Canyon Campground, Hilltop Campground, Willow Creek Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground and Rocky Gap Campground. This includes the following roads... Kyle Canyon Road between mile markers 1 and 16. Lee Canyon Road between mile marker 1 and 13. State Route 160 in Clark County between mile marker 39 and 43. Deer Creek Road between mile markers 1 and 8. State Route 159 in Red Rock Canyon between mile marker 8 and 12. State Route 160 in Nye County between mile markers 1 and 18. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wheeler Wash and Cold Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
